headline: Absolute Mexican Cornbread
description: This Mexican cornbread is the best. Moist and packed with flavor from bits of corn, chiles, and cheese baked in for a tasty spin on a classic dish.

video.description: See how to make moist and tasty cornbread with a kick.
video.name: Absolute Mexican Cornbread

name: Absolute Mexican Cornbread
recipeIngredient: 0.5 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Beat together butter and sugar in a large bowl. Beat in eggs one at a time. Blend in corn, chiles, Monterey Jack cheese, and Cheddar cheese.
Stir together flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to corn mixture; stir until smooth. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the pan comes out clean.

review.reviewBody: I made no changes whatsoever. It came out perfect was delicious I'll be making it more often.

It had just the right kick. We happen to have a jar of jalapenos in the refrigerator so I sliced up a quarter cup instead of buying canned. My company liked it and I shared with a neighbor too. Everyone liked it

So this was my first time attempting to make Mexican cornbread and I have to say I was displeased. I was expecting crumbly with a hint of spice. I found neither in this recipe. I would definitely recommend adding more green Chili’s or maybe just using jalapeños instead. Also I feel the cream corn made it have more of a cake texture than cornbread. It tasted fine, just not what I was looking for.

I've made this cornbread at least a dozen times or more. Its moist and delicious and everyone loves it. Not your typical dry cornbread. I've made a few slight variations but all have come out great. I cut the butter bit. I cut the sugar a bit. I used a whole can of green chiles. I added a can of white corn niblets. I used 1/2 cup pepper jack cheese and cut out the rest of the cheese (I'm not a big cheese fan). Glass 9x13 and cooked for about 80minutes @300 but I think my oven is not as hot as others.
I added a small can of sweet corn to this. It was so good. Also used the whole can of green chilis.
I cut ⅓ cup of the sugar and added 2oz. more diced green Chiles. Turned out great. Love this recipe.
Very tasty and moist, even though I, like others, used half the butter (and about 3/4 cup of sugar).
Cut the butter & Sugar in Half and it will be delicious!!!!
I have made this 6 times it comes out perfect every time, I think some have a problem with their oven. It is always a huge hit and we never have leftovers
Made it exactly per the recipe and it just won 1st place at the church chili & cornbread cookoff. Thanks! Super moist. Doesn't need butter, honey or anything on it. Perfect!
Best cornbread I've ever made or eaten! Even my picky grandson couldn't get enough of it.
Delectable and Sweet.
Very good recipe! I also cut back on sugar to 3/4 cups. Must admit I did 2c of grated cheese. Its just sweet enough for me! Thnx for sharing.

I made it as a gift for some friends so I was disappointed that it wasn’t very good. I just couldn’t put all that butter in it and I cut back on the sugar. It was still oily and too sweet. It wasn’t flavorful and the consistency was more gooey than cornbread even though it was definitely done. I wish I had added some heat and used all cheddar cheese. If I make Mexican cornbread again, I’m going to find a skillet recipe.

Awesome recipe - the only addition I made was two tablespoons of whole milk to dethicken the batter. Turned out perfect, my husband now calls it “crack” cornbread. Mine was done in 55 minutes in a convection oven. Kept on warm for another 15 minutes.
No corn it’s very good

Way too much butter! Cut it in half. Way, way too much sugar too. 1/4 cup is plenty! (This is not supposed to be a dessert) 
I added chopped green onion and some diced pickled jalapeño slices. 

The 300 degrees for one hour is also off. At the end of an hour I had to increase the temp to 375 and bake for an additional 13 minutes. Whoever made this recipe needs to tweak it badly. I was surprised and disappointed.

Hey everyone, this cornbread by Judy is freaking AMAZING!!! I made this for Thanksgiving this year and it overshadowed all the other dishes. 
Thanks Judy sharing your absolutely amazing Mexican cornbread!
It was fye
Best Mexican cornbread I’ve ever made!!
This cornbread was so good, it was almost like cake. You could top it with sour cream and chives to make it more savory, or just eat it by itself for a treat.
Delicious! Made as written other than using the full 4 oz can of chiles. Added another 10 minutes at 400 to the end of baking.
Great recipe, not sweet corncake. Just the right amount of sweet and great taste will make again on a regular
This recipe is perfect, just the way it is! I've made it many times and it turns out great every single time. Thanks for sharing!
This cornbread is attractive and very moist. Almost like dessert. We froze extra and it was still very good warmed up in microwave.
This is the best cornbread! Don’t change a thing.

Great comments received when I brought this to work for a soup fundraiser we did. I brought it in hot (made in Pampered Chef 9x13 stones). Definitely agree with other comments about using 1/2 cup butter and 1/2 cup sugar, everything else the same. Was plenty moist and sweet enough.
Best Cornbread ever! Can make it Gluten Free by substituting gluten free flour for regular flour.
Too sweet. A lot of extra ingredients don't payout with the flavor.
This is as good as everyone says it is. The balance of sweet and slightly spicy was exact. I'm making this one again!

I’ve been making this cornbread for years. Not sure why others had greasy bread as this bakes up perfect every time. One think is that this is not a 6 person serving. Like yes, 6 people can eat the tray , but I usually cut it into 12 and freeze it with chilli for lunches.
Fantastic! Thanks for sharing.

Modified to 1/2 cup butter/1 stick, 3/4 cup sugar or slightly less. Sifted all dry ingred + onion pwdr, garlic powder, cayenne. Omitted corn so added buttermilk + Greek yogurt. Added minced garlic, 1/2 jap,bell pepper to chiles and mixed with cheeses last. Poured in full muffins @300 for 25mins.. Unbelievably good
This is the best Corn Bread ever, I added jalapeños to enhance the taste! My family and friends always ask me to make it! Making it for a Mexican New Years Celebration!!
Great, sweet and moist cornbread!
12/18/20 Wonderful flavor. A little on the sweet side, just the way I like it.
don't have to do an absolute thing! made it as written and it is the best cornbread I have ever tasted!! will be in my recipe book!!
THE BEST cornbread ever!!! Moist and delicious! It makes more than 6 servings! I had to use two skillets.
We used to have a favorite that I couldn't find and THEN I found THIS....it IS the best ever according to my husband (and me) - so moist, delicious and easy!!!!! THANK YOU!

Very good, sweet, moist, almost cake like bread. I make different kinds of cornbread. Some are not sweet, more coarse texture, etc. We enjoy them all with different main courses or in something, like dressing. 13x9 pan of it is not too much around here! This one is very good with Mimi's (me) Famous Home Made Soup!
Husband said it is a “keeper”!
Best cornbread recipe ever moist and flavorful, my family just loved it. Will be only cornbread recipe I use from now on!
Good stuff but I will Troy it with regulars or fresh not cream corn next time to reduce sweetness and moisture. WIll also add sliced fresh jalapeños on top for baking!

This was the best cornbread I've ever made. The only thing I'd change is that I'd put the whole can of green chilies in it.
Went great with taco soup!!

I would definitely do this again but I did reduce the sugar to 3/4 cup also added an entire can of drained green chili’s. It was excellent but being from Texas would add one jalapeño diced into the mix to kick it up a notch.

This is absolutely HORRIBLE! I needed a good Mexican cornbread recipe and saw this one had almost five stars so went with it. I mixed up a double batch because it says serves six, but definitely serves at least twelve normal people. I tasted the batter before putting it in the pan, and holy sugar!!! 

I went back to the reviews and saw that most people who gave it five stars COMPLETELY OVERHAULED the original recipe. How can you give something five stars if it isn't even the recipe you MADE? 

Now I'm stuck with a giant bowl of batter that I wouldn't feed to anyone I like.

I make this recipe quite often as it’s a fan favorite. I’ve made it using all the original directions and I will agree that it’s super greasy, BUT no one cares and they were gone within the hour. The alterations I make sometimes: only 1/2 cup of butter, 1/2 cup sugar and instead of creamed corn, I put salsa. It gives it the taste of corn tortillas with salsa. I also bake them in muffin cups and half the bake time. This makes it easy to share at gatherings.

Truly delightful. I cut back the sugar to 1/3 cup and it was still plenty sweet. I took other peoples advice and used a half a stick of butter and a couple tablespoons of vegetable oil. I added some chopped red peppers and lots of jalapeños. Are used frozen corn kernels instead of creamed, but I did a little heavy cream to make up for it.
Made with 1/2 the butter and 3/4 c sugar- delicious!
After reading other reviews, I added extra of most ingredients to balance the heavy sugar and butter. Came out great! Crispy edges and moist inside.
I think this is the best Mexican cornbread anywhere. I made mine as muffins instead of whole pan.
I have made this recipe several times, my husband loves it!

This is the second time that I've made this recipe. The first time I followed the recipe and thought that it was too buttery and too much sugar. 

The second time that I made this recipe, I halved the butter and sugar and substituted brown sugar. I also used unbleached flour. 

I WILL make this recipe again per my changes and reduce the flour and increase the cornmeal.
Turned out as near perfect as advertised. Wow! What a treat. If you a fan of cornbreads; this is the one that’s not that dry and grainy type. It’s moist...did I say moist? It is moist and delicious.

This is delicious. I followed others advice and cut the butter in half. I also questioned the oven temperature. Tried it at 300 and it came out kind of flat and dense. Increased it to 350 the next time for 30 minutes and it rose nicely and was perfect.
Turned out great, had a lot of compliments on this recipe. I will keep this in my favorites.
We really liked the receipe. I made it to go with chicken chili, and it was delicious. I add jalapenos in it to add a little spice. Will make it a again!

I had read the other reviews and made it just as written in the recipe; I also found it very oily when hot from the oven... so don’t be surprised. After cooling the bread became much better. Since then have added hatch green chili and cut the sugar in half - love it
Some of the best cornbread that I've had or made. I made it in a 12" cast iron skillet in the oven. It's very moist and kept well for several days at room temperature in a plastic pie carrier.

Tastes super good. I didnt think I would have such a problem loading my pan to the top. I was very wrong. The USA pan is stupidly nonstick so cleaning was a non issue. 8x pan isn't large enough. That's my fault though.

I made this for our Christmas dinner. It was a huge hit! The cornbread is sweet with a hint of heat, moist, and buttery. My husband is still raving about it.

I didn’t have creamed corn, so used kernel corn. I also added a quarter cup of diced red bell pepper. Absolutely delicious...
Love this cornbread!!

after reading others reviews. I only added a third cup of butter and 1/3 cup of sugar. and I use the whole can of green chilies and added a little extra cheese. needless to say it turned out fabulous! yes I recommend this recipe with the adjustments that were made.

I changed it up a little bit. I cooked it at 385 in a cast iron skillet, used whole kernel corn and a little bit of milk. also used 1 cup of mexican blend cheese rather than the Monterey jack and cheddar. I diced up canned jalapenos instead of the chilies. my boyfriend ate more than I have ever seen him eat.. at first told me it was the best thing i had weve made but then retracted and said it was the best thing he had ever had in his life. less than an hour after it came out of the oven.. he is in bed in a full blown level 5 food coma. this is NOT a drill.

Altered this based on a number of comments and received rave reviews from family!
- reduce sugar to 1/3 cup (from 1)
- reduce butter to 6 tbsp (from 16)
- added in extra peppers
- topped with jalapeño rings
I did make some changes. I made my own cream corn, used rotel tomatoes and Jalapeno peppers also I added hot sausage. Me I am a taster so I tasted the mix after I mixed it all up. Very Tastey
Delicious, but too sweet for my taste. 3/4 cup of sugar would suffice.

Best cornbread ever! I got tons of compliments on this at a potluck and subsequently made it for Thanksgiving instead of buying rolls. Huge hit - this will be my go-to recipe! I used 1/2 cup (1 stick) of butter and 3/4 sugar based on reviews and wouldn't change either from there. I also just use whatever shredded cheese I have on hand (marble jack).

My family and I thought this recipe was too greasy. I made it with 1 c of butter, reduced the sugar to 1/2 c., and used the full can of diced green chiles. It had good flavor, but the consistency was dense. It went well with chili. I will try making it again and reducing the butter to 1/2 c.
Great recipe except for one thing: use homemade cream corn instead of store bought. What a difference it makes. Grocery store cream corn does not even come close to homemade in taste or smell.
I grew up on Jiffy cornbread. So I totally love this sweet cornbread. It is so moist almost like cake!
made it and loved it! turned out great!

Like other reviewers, i used a half cup of butter instead of a full cup, and I used 3/4 cup of sugar instead of a full cup. I substituted a 4 oz can of diced jalapenos instead of green chiles, and I used the whole can. It turned out great. The bread was sweet, had a moist texture, and it had a nice kick to it with the jalas.
Delicious. Especially with some chili. I might up the heat a bit.

I halved the recipe, used finely chopped red onion instead of peppers (it’s all i had), and baked it for 35 minutes in a pie pan. It was not greasy. I read some other reviews. Is it possible the people who found it greasy measured the butter after melting and not before? I found it to be delicious.
I followed the recipe exactly and it came out perfect. It went beautifully with my husband spicy all meat chili. This is a go to recipe for my family.

no i did not change anything....it had way to much butter and was to sweet. I thought i would try it.What a waste of butter 4 eggs, time. My family did not like it ,. plus the cheese expense
i would not make it again!!! my rate would be minus a star.

I cut butter to 1/2 cup and sugar to 1/2cup as other suggested and added another can of creamed corn. It was moist and so good. I also added a few more jalapeños from my garden to make spicier. Will make again and again. Loved it. Thanks for the recipe.
This was delicious! I used shredded pepper jack cheese in place of Colby jack, and I added the whole can of green chilies. I will be making it again!!!

Had to leave a review on this because this sounded amazing but some of the reviews were mixed. I really don’t understand the hate because THIS WAS THE MOST AMAZING CORNBREAD EVER. This was everything I’ve ever wanted in a cornbread and omg did it deliver. I followed this recipe to the letter and it came out phenomenally. If you love your cornbread sweet and chunky like I do then this recipe is perfect for you and goes amazingly with chili. My hubby was spooning in with his chili and loved it. I wish it weren’t so crumbly but that’s my only complaint. Fabulous recipe!!!

I'm a born, bred and lifelong southerner and I'm here to tell you that this stuff is the best cornbread ever!

Suggestion to all you folks who change a recipe up then rate it for the rest of us - don't cut down on the ingredients, cut down on your portion size! I ate only a 1"x1" piece and it was to die for! If I'd eaten the size recommended, I probably would have died.

Happy I looked at the reviews. 
I cut back a bit on the butter and sugar. Still very moist. Would prob add the whole can of peppers next time for a bit more kick but overall great recipe. Thanks

This is hands down the best corn bread that I have made and I have tried way too many recipes to count! It is sweet, with a hint of spicy that makes you want to have more than one serving. It is absolutely delicious and moist, not crumbly like other recipes.
 I added Jalapenos to the mix, instead of green chiles, because I was out of that one ingredient. It came out great and my whole family loved it. This goes well with homemade chili and I am looking forward to making this recipe often when the weather turns cool.
Cornbread does not need sugar. At all. I made without sugar and it has plenty of flavor. I imagine my grandmother rolling in her grave if I ever added sugar....

Good recipe. I could tell by the ingredients it was going to turn out gummy and too sweet. I also could tell there would be no spice making it "Mexican" cornbread. So made with 6 Tbsp. of butter, approx. 1/4 tsp. red pepper, approx 1/4 cup mild jalapenos. It still came out sweet , moist and very little "heat" so I will probably switch to medium jalapenos next time.
Amazing cornbread! So moist and tasty. I make this regularly and guests always go back for more of it! Stick to the recipe and you can't go wrong. It's a big hit during Mexican night!

4 Stars with changes -- 1/2 the butter, 1/3 cup sugar. I sautéed chopped red, orange, and green peppers and 2 jalapenos in a small bit of olive oil to add to the mix. I don't know if it changed the taste much, but nice texture and looked pretty. With these changes, I think this was the best cornbread I've ever made. I can't imagine making this with the amount of butter listed (sorry). THANK You to other reviewers for suggesting the changes that made this awesome.
I made some of the recommended changes (e.g., less sugar) and didn't have any creamed corn, so replaced it with frozen corn & a splash of cream. It was a HUGE hit with my family!

Delightful!!! Followed recipe as written but exchanged green chiles with 2 ounces of finely chopped jalapeño peppers. Absolutely perfect recipe when the butter, sugar and eggs are actually properly “creamed”! No need to reduce the butter or the sugar folks....the recipe is perfect and browns nicely. Cornbread was done at 55 minutes and beautifully golden brown around the edge!

The moment I made this I believe 5 years ago I knew it was a hit . I just recently made it for the church they loved it. I made it for my families Sunday Dinner my grandma had two slices. It was so moist and soft. I cut the amount of butter in Half. I omitted spicy peppers and it was delightful thank you for sharing this recipe.

This was fabulous! I made it to go with the King Ranch Chicken Casserole. I regularly make normal cornbread, so this was great for spicing it up for the fam! The kids loved it as is, but I think I could’ve used the whole can of chilis without making it too spicy. Loved it!
My family loved this but I did take everyone’s advice and half the butter and sugar.

Very similar to Moms recipe and good. One suggestion, add one small jar of pimientos, drained, for color. I usually add the cream corn and then the milk to see if I need more liquid. I usually cook mine in a cast iron skillet, help get the bottom crispy.
Very moist, best cornbread ever. I cut the sugar to 3/4 cup. 3rd time to make it. Family loves it.

So good! I did reduce the butter to 1/2 Cup, and reduced the sugar to 3/4 Cup (still a tad sweeter than I prefer), and used the whole can of chilies. I cut it into 15 pieces, at 183 calories per piece (based on my changes).
Family loved it! I only used half the butter and it was fine.
I cooked this exactly as the recipe said and it is amazing! This goes perfect with chili or a pot of beans, or who am I kidding anything! Seriously, this is so good and a favorite at our house.

I made this to go with a Mexican meal and everyone loved it. I cut the butter to 1/2 a cup (one stick) & I think that was perfect. No other changes & I baked it in my 12 in. cast-iron skillet at 325. Preheat the oven with the oiled skillet in it before adding batter to hot skillet. Great recipe & will make again!
This is sooo good. I just made it and it is delicious in some chili.
